title: Live Briefing: Syrian rebel forces fight to consolidate control
content: Rebel forces led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham said they took control of Deir al-Zour in eastern Syria. Israel said its extensive strikes were to prevent a future attack.
summary: Rebel forces led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham said they took control of Deir al-Zour in eastern Syria. Israel said its extensive strikes were to prevent a future attack.

title: Who is Mohammed al-Bashir, Syria’s new caretaker prime minister?

title: Tycoon Adani pulls request for U.S. loan to finance strategic Sri Lanka port
content: The withdrawal marks another low point in U.S.-India ties after the billionaire’s indictment on charges related to fraud, and a blow to Washington’s bid to counter China’s regional clout.
summary: The withdrawal marks another low point in U.S.-India ties after the billionaire’s indictment on charges related to fraud, and a blow to Washington’s bid to counter China’s regional clout.

title: Afghan blast kills key minister, shocking Taliban
content: Khalil Haqqani was the acting minister for refugees and a key member of the notorious Haqqani network.

title: Who is Kim Guilfoyle? Trump taps ex-Fox News host, lawyer as Greek ambassador.
content: Trump announced his intent to nominate Kim Guilfoyle — a former Fox News host, political fundraiser and fiancée of son Don Jr. —  to become U.S. ambassador to Greece.
summary: Trump announced his intent to nominate Kim Guilfoyle — a former Fox News host, political fundraiser and fiancée of son Don Jr. —  to become U.S. ambassador to Greece.

content: In a viral video, a man interrupted a British journalist interviewing a mother on sexual harassment and made sexist comments, forcing the women to leave.

title: These preteen go-kart drivers are spending millions for a shot at F1 racing
content: Parents are spending millions on karting for their kids, hoping it will eventually catapult them into F1 racing. It’s a mad, mad world. And we go inside.
summary: Parents are spending millions on karting for their kids, hoping it will eventually catapult them into F1 racing. It’s a mad, mad world. And we go inside.

title: Australian leader decries hate crimes after another antisemitic attack
content: Australian politicians are warning against “importing conflicts” after the second antisemitic attack in a week. The incidents have shaken the Jewish community.

content: Ukraine has demonstrated skill with long-range drones, hitting deep inside Russia, but experts say it needs the punch and power of ballistic missiles, as well.

title: South Korean prosecutors weigh arresting president for insurrection
content: Police tried to raid President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office in martial law investigation. Yoon’s former defense minister, who has been arrested, attempted suicide in detention.

title: U.S. group travels to Syria in search of missing reporter Austin Tice

title: Mazen al-Hamada, symbol of Syrian regime’s brutality, confirmed dead
content: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.
summary: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.

title: In Syria’s former ‘slaughterhouse,’ a desperate hunt for the disappeared
content: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.
summary: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.

title: About 26 killed in strike in Beit Hanoun in north Gaza, rescue workers say
